scenarioDescription:
The CoRoT-8 Exoplanetary System


Overview

CoRoT-8 is a star with 0.88 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.77 times its radius. It is located 1050.34 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

CoRoT-8 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the CoRoT-8 system


CoRoT-8 b

CoRoT-8 b was discovered by the CoRoT observatory, in 2010-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of CoRoT-8 b is 69.960 times the mass of Earth. The radius of CoRoT-8 b is 6.390 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, CoRoT-8 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system CoRoT-8, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the CoRoT.
name: CoRoT-8 - System With 1 Exoplanet
